articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Sympathy to President of DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Sympathy to President of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy on Wednesday to Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of DR Congo, in connection with the fact that a ship sinking accident occurred in DR Congo recently, claiming huge casualties.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and condolences for the president, victims and their bereaved families.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Senegalese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Senegalese President
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Macky Sall, president of Senegal, on April 1 on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of its independence.
					 In the belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger in line with the common interests and desire of the two peoples, the message wished the Senegalese president and people greater success in their work to ensure the peace and stability of the country and achieve its economic development.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Slovak President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Slovak President
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on March 31 sent a message of greeting to Andrej Kiska who was elected president of Slovakia.
					 The message expressed conviction that the relations between the DPRK and Slovakia would steadily develop in line with common interests and desire of the peoples of the two countries, wishing the president of Slovakia success in his work for the country's development and prosperity and the people's well-being.

articles.title: Condolences to Foreign Minister of DR Congo
articles.content:
Condolences to Foreign Minister of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday sent a condolatory message to Raymond Tchibanda Ntounga Moulongo, minister of Foreign Affairs, Cooperation and Francophone Affairs of DR Congo, in connection with the fact that a ship sinking accident occurred in DR Congo, claiming huge casualties.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and condolences for the bereaved families and victims.

articles.title: KPA Commanding Officers Make Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
KPA Commanding Officers Make Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Commanding officers of the combined units of the Korean People's Army (KPA) made a study tour of the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu from Mar. 23 to April 1.
					 There took place a ceremony before starting the tour in front of the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo in Hyesan City, Ryanggang Province on Mar. 23.
					
					 The officers placed a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statue of President Kim Il Sung in the monument and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting expressed the determination to deeply grasp the origination of the Songun revolution and the history of its proud victory through the tour and firmly prepare themselves into the reliable defenders and steadfast personifiers of the revolutionary traditions.
					
					 Then they started the tour.
					
					 Arriving in the historic land where the battle of Pochonbo commanded by the President was fought, they went round various places of the battle site.
					
					 They visited General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp on Mar. 24.
					
					 They toured the Sajabong Secret Camp, Rimyongsu Revolutionary Site and Chongbong, Konchang and Pegaebong bivouacs and on March 27 marched along the Kapsan-Musan guard road and arrived in the Samjiyon Revolutionary Battle Site on Mar. 27.
					
					 They placed a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statue of the President and paid tribute to him.
					
					  After arriving at the Monument to the Victorious Musan Area Battle via the Mupho Bivouac and the Sinsadong Revolutionary Battle Site, they held a shooting competition at the battle site of Taehongdan. They held an oath-taking meeting before a monument at fork to Mt. Paektu and headed for the Samjiyon Grand Monument.
					
					 A meeting of commanding officers of combined units of the KPA was held with splendor at the plaza of the Samjiyon Grand Monument in the presence of Marshal Kim Jong Un. The participants pledged to fully arm themselves with the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu and remain loyal to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They held various events such as a meeting to expressing impressions of reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas read by them, a bonfire fathering and a question-and-answer study contest.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation headed by V.V. Grishkov, first secretary of the regional committee, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 The members of the delegation paid tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secreatry Kim Jong Il who made immortal contributions to the development of the friendly relations among countries.
					
					 Entering the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, they made a bow.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls that house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Russian Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Russian Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation led by First Secretary V.V. Grishkov visited President Kim Il Sung's birthplace in Mangyongdae.
					 Being briefed on the story about the native home at which the President was born and nurtured the lofty intention of the revolution in his childhood, the members of the delegation looked round the historic relics preserved with much care.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Party Founding Museum, Tower of the Juche Idea, Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, Meari Shooting Gallery, etc.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation.
					 The gift was handed over to an official concerned on April 3 by First Secretary V.V. Grishkov who is leading the delegation of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation.

articles.title: Mongolian Guests Leave
articles.content:
Mongolian Guests Leave
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Minister of Industry and Agriculture Khaltmaa Battulga who is chairman of the Mongolian side to the Inter-governmental Committee for Consultation in Economy, Trade, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Mongolia, and his party left here for home on Thursday.

articles.title: Concert Given by Agricultural Workers, UAWK Members
articles.content:
Concert Given by Agricultural Workers, UAWK Members
 Phyongwon, April 3 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) gave a concert at the Wonhwa Cooperative Farm in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province on April 3 to mark the 21st anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 Present there were Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the union, officials concerned and agricultural workers and union members in the county.
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers such as dialogic poem "Wish", instrumental ensemble "Our General is the Best", narration and quintet "Thanks to the Fatherly General" and male solo "Song of Love for People".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the whole life of Kim Jong Il, who had performed undying feats for the times and revolution with his outstanding idea and great revolutionary practice after embarking upon the road of the Songun revolution, true to the lofty intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Such numbers as accordion duet "Song of Plowing" and comic story "It Is Good" vividly represented a turn effected in the agricultural development of the country and rural communities turning into a socialist fairyland under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Also put on the stage were numbers showing the will of the people to firmly believe in and follow supreme leader Kim Jong Un in one mind.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as Chairman of DPRK National Defence Commission Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as NDC Chairman Observed
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A presentation of officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) to hear impressions of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's virtues took place at the Hall of Women on Thursday to mark the 21st anniversary of his election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission (NDC).
					 Present there were Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the DWUK, and officials and members of the women's union.
					
					 Speakers said that Kim Jong Il's election as NDC chairman was a political event of great significance in carrying forward generation after generation the Juche cause of the army-building hewed out by President Kim Il Sung and further developing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 After assuming the heavy duty as NDC chairman, Kim Jong Il performed great exploits in the national history and humankind's history by wisely leading the efforts to strengthen the national power and defend the supreme interests of the state with arms, they noted.
					
					 The Korean revolutionary armed forces will steadily be strengthened to be the invincible army and the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered in Mt. Paektu be accomplished as the Korean people have Marshal Kim Jong Un at the helm of the party, state, and army, they stressed.
					
					 They vowed to discharge their responsibility and duty as Korean women in the era of Songun in the ongoing general advance to bring earlier the final victory in the efforts for the building of a thriving nation, remaining loyal to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize Opens
articles.content:
National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize Opens
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The National Martial Art Championship for Mangyongdae Prize opened with due ceremony at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Thursday.
					 It is bringing together players of Taekwon-do teams and various other units from across the country. They will compete in Taekwon-Do, paduk (go), wushu and karate games.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C. of the WPK, officials concerned, players, coaches, youth and students.
					
					 Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, in an opening address said that Taekwon-Do is developing day by day, demonstrating the resourcefulness and valor of the Korean nation before the world.
					
					 He called upon all players and coaches to give full play to their techniques. 
					
					 Players and instructors of the National Taekwon-Do Team presented demonstrations.

articles.title: Bumper Harvest of Mushroom in Chongsan Village
articles.content:
Bumper Harvest of Mushroom in Chongsan Village
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Chongsan Co-op Farm, Kangso District, Nampho City got big profits through mushroom growing.
					 There are modern greenhouses covering thousands of square meters and small greenhouses in dozens of threshing grounds of workteams on the farm and in the gardens of more than a thousand houses.
					
					 Farmers cultivate vegetables of various species in summer and mushrooms in autumn and winter there.
					
					 A total of 60 tons of mushroom were harvested from September last year to March this year.
					
					 The farm has started cultivating mushroom in a big way since 20 years back.
					
					 It helped farmers bear in mind that mushroom growing is important for improving the diet of the people. It, at the same time, intensified the dissemination of science and technology for mushroom growing such as cultivating spores and substrate in close touch with the Central Mushroom Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences.
					
					 Mushroom was cultivated on an experiment basis at the greenhouses in the farm seat while exemplary units were chosen for generalizing their experience in other units and households.
					
					 As a result, mushroom harvest has shown a steady increase every year. Over 50 households harvested more than 200 kg of mushroom on average.
					
					The mushroom growing is contributing to steadily improving the farmers' living and the farm's financial conditions.

articles.title: New Far Infrared Radiators Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Far Infrared Radiators Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Nano Materials Institute under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK developed new highly-efficient far infrared radiators of the international standard.
					 Their emissivity reaches over 90 percent. And they are highly resistant to heat and mechanical shock, while saving much electricity.
					
					 They have been applied to heat-treatment and drying processes as well as coating and hardening processes in many factories including chemical, textile, shoes and foodstuff factories and timber mills.
					
					 The radiators have proved effective in cutting drying hours and increasing the quality of products.
					
					 The institute has manufactured sterilizers, thermostats and portable medical treatment devices based on those radiators.

articles.title: Vol. 3 of "Collection of Kim Il Sung's Anecdotes" Published in DPRK
articles.content:
Vol. 3 of "Collection of Kim Il Sung's Anecdotes" Published in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Vol. 3 of "Collection of Kim Il Sung's Anecdotes", a cycle of revolutionary anecdotes, was published in the DPRK.
					 The book contains revolutionary anecdotes dealing with the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by President Kim Il Sung from April, Juche 21 (1932) to March, Juche 25 (1936), divided into 4 chapters.
					
					 Edited in Chapter 9 are anecdotes dealing with the exploits he performed by founding the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army and dynamically waging the armed struggle against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Recorded there are stories about the days when he made an expedition to south Manchuria and anecdotes dealing with his revolutionary activities in the area of Wangqing afterwards.
					
					 Chapter 10 carries anecdotes about the facts that he built the people's power and prepared the guerrillas and people in the guerrilla zone to be steadfast revolutionary fighters after moving the Command to Xiaowangqing.
					
					 Recorded in Chapter 11 are anecdotes dealing with the facts that he instilled the conviction of certain victory into the people and showed loving care for them in the guerrilla zone in Yaoyinggou and stories in the days of the first expedition to north Manchuria.
					
					 Contained in Chapter 12 are anecdotes dealing with the historical facts that he resolutely struggled against the Left chauvinists at the Dahuangwai Meeting to tide over the crisis prevailing in the Korean revolution.
					
					 The book also carries stories that he led many battles to victory in the days of his second expedition to north Manchuria.

articles.title: DPRK Servicepersons Vow to Punish S. Korean Military Gangsters
articles.content:
DPRK Servicepersons Vow to Punish S. Korean Military Gangsters
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- All servicepersons in the DPRK are now vowing to take thousand-fold revenge on the south Korean military provokers who committed shuddering atrocities against its sailors.
					 The naval gangsters of south Korea recently seized a fishing boat of the DPRK and beat its defenseless crewmen into coma with iron bars and put them in fetters, forcing "defection".
					
					 Han Kyong Nam, an officer of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA:
					
					 It is the strong will of my unit to blow up the den of the gangsters with shower of fire.
					
					 Such rude gangsterism can never be tolerated and our army's merciless shelling is fit for the south Korean military and its gangsters preoccupied by confrontation conception.
					
					 Kim Myong Chol, a KPA officer, said:
					
					 The south Korean military has staged ceaseless war games in league with the U.S. and conducted anti-DPRK leaflet scattering. Not content with such provocations, its gangers attacked our fishing boat and its crewmen in a cruel manner this time.
					
					 This piracy is a serious provocation to the DPRK that can never be overlooked.
					
					 The south Korean military gangsters should not expect any mercy from the DPRK whose servicepersons will annihilate all those savages to the last one.
					
					 Pak Kwang Hyok, a KPA noncommissioned officer, said:
					
					 The recent provocation by those pirates on Paekryong Island was apparently manipulated by Park Geun Hye, the boss of Chongwadae, and the military warmongers.
					
					 We are fully ready to mete out a punishment to the Park Geun Hye group keen in doing all sorts of evils.
					
					 Once an order is given, the Paektusan army will reduce into ashes the enemy's naval base on Paekryong Island and all other dens of provokers.

articles.title: DPRK Workers Vow to Wipe Out S. Korean Pirates
articles.content:
DPRK Workers Vow to Wipe Out S. Korean Pirates
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Atrocities committed by a group of south Korean naval pirates against the crewmen of a DPRK fishing boat have lashed all the people in the DPRK, including workers, into fury.
					 Jang Chol Ryong, the crew leader of a furnace at the Chollima Steel Complex, said:
					
					 The workers of the complex are in a mind to bring into electric furnace the group of pirates and other human dregs such as Park Geun Hye who has patronized them.
					
					 The pirates on Paekryong Island and the south Korean military, bereft of elementary morality, are villains without parallel in the world and the source of misfortune.
					
					 Words do not go through with such villains. What is needed is to beat with a sledgehammer into pieces those gangsters hell-bent on confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Kim Myong Sik, manager of the Tonggu Housing Construction Company, said: 
					
					 The criminal acts committed by the pirates on Paekryong Island can never be tolerated.
					
					 Paekryong Island, used as a base for spying on the DPRK for scores of years, should have been burnt to ashes long ago.
					
					 It is the will of the workers of my company to make the south Korean military gangsters pay a dear price for their inhumane acts.
					
					 Kwon Sun Il, a worker at the Taehung Youth Hero Mine, said:
					
					 It is so natural to punish before anybody else Park Geun Hye, who defends such military gangsters engaged in atrocities against fellow countrymen while calling for "human rights" and "initiative on peaceful unification" outside.
					
					 Park and her group of traitors should be put into a dead pit.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Sparking Reckless Arms Race
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Sparking Reckless Arms Race
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is mulling test-firing ultra-modern supersonic missiles capable of striking any targets in the world within an hour as part of its desperate move to build a European missile shield.
					 This is a revelation of the U.S. reckless scenario to realize its wild ambition to dominate the world at any cost, backed by its military supremacy, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a commentary.
					
					 The U.S. moves to build the missile shield in Europe and develop supersonic missiles are bringing a new Cold War to the world, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Early in this year China test-fired a supersonic missile the highest speed of which is 10 times that of sound. Russia is reportedly developing ultra supersonic weapons and India has also joined in such a race. The facts prove that a new arms race has already started.
					
					 The U.S. seeks to put spurs to such worldwide arms race by conducting another ultra supersonic missile launching test.
					
					 The number of those countries seeking to develop ultra supersonic missiles is poised to increase in the future to accelerate the arms race.
					
					 What the U.S. should know is that such reckless moves for military supremacy will only lead to its self-ruin. 
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the U.S. has serious financial doldrums.
					
					It is, therefore, the U.S. which will suffer from the escalated worldwide arms race.
					
					 The U.S. had better stop running riot, aware of where it stands.
					
					 It would be well advised to behave with reason if it doesn't want to fall into decay and ruin and meet the same miserable fate as that of the second Roman Empire.

articles.title: WPK's Line on Simultaneously Carrying On Economic Construction, Building of Nuclear Forces Is Justifiable
articles.content:
WPK's Line on Simultaneously Carrying On Economic Construction, Building of Nuclear Forces Is Justifiable
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The international political order has now been under the influence of the permanent members of the United Nations Security Council, all of which are nuclear states.
					 The cold war had persisted worldwide and there have been a number of wars in various regions for nearly 70 years after the emergence of nukes, but there has been no military aggression on any of the nuclear weapon states.
					
					 Instead, the nuclear powers have engaged themselves in arbitrariness against non-nuclear weapon states.
					
					 The U.S. cruise missile attack on a sovereign state in daylight and  violation of innocent people's right to existence have been considered to be justifiable ones aimed at "defending the world peace and human rights".
					
					 It is the only way for sovereign nations to possess their own powerful war deterrent in order to create peaceful environment and conditions for their economic development and improvement of people's living.
					
					 Tragedies caused in different countries and regions in recent years remind one of the validity and vitality of the line of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on simultaneously carrying on the economic construction and the building of nuclear forces.
					
					 But, the hostile forces are making distortion of the essence of the line, terming it "unscientific" and "bellicose".
					
					 On the one hand, they are pressurizing the DPRK to give up the nukes for economic development and, on the other hand, they are cajoling it with honeyed words that they will help it develop the economy once it abandons the nukes. Such moves are nothing but an attempt to prevent the DPRK from growing stronger in face of all sorts of challenges.
					
					 Now the DPRK, as a full-fledged nuclear state, has a favorable condition to concentrate all efforts on economic construction and improvement of people's living in reliance upon the powerful war deterrent.
					
					 The hostile forces are seeking to suffocate the DPRK by inveigling it into arms race, but the DPRK is channeling big efforts into economic construction and improvement of the people's living while steadily beefing up war deterrent without increasing defense expenditures.
					
					 Bolstering self-defensive nuclear deterrent precisely means economic construction.
					
					 Sustained development of nuclear and space rocket technologies is instrumental to upgrading the nation's science to the world's level.
					
					 Development of the Juche-oriented atomic power industry also makes it possible to settle the nation's electricity shortage.
					
					 Indeed, the line has turned the DPRK's geopolitical position into one decisive of the world's political structure.
					
					 The DPRK can greatly benefit from nuclear test and it will drastically cut down investment into manufacturing conventional weapons but channel more fund into developing the economy. This is the view of the entire Korean nation and the world's progressives on the WPK's line.
					
					 The WPK's new line is scientific and truthful.
					
					 The DPRK people will steadfastly maintain the line they have chosen in face of all sorts of challenges.
					
					 Time and justice stand on the side of the DPRK and final victory is in store for it.

articles.title: S. Korean Civic Organization Launches Hunger Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Civic Organization Launches Hunger Strike 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Emergency Situation Council to Denounce IS Interference in Presidential Election for Political Operation in south Korea entered into a hunger strike calling for staging a 100,000-people candlelight action in protest against the present regime's injustice, according to the south Korean paper Labor and World.
					 A press conference for declaring the hunger strike took place at Chonggye Square in Seoul on March 31.
					
					 At the press conference, speakers charged that the truth behind the election rigging with the Intelligence Service, the military, etc. involved in it was disclosed but anyone has not yet been punished. 
					
					 Those criminals including Nam Jae Jun, IS director, Hwang Kyo An, minister of Justice, and Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defence, should certainly be dismissed and the IS, a group of criminals, be dissolved, they held.
					
					 Injustice such as the election rigging can not be connived at, they said, calling for turning out in the action to denounce the election rigging by the Park Guen Hye's group and punish the prime movers. 
					
					 They called for staging the 100,000-people candlelight action on the day marking the 54th anniversary of the April 19 Uprising in which the people turned out in the action in protest against the election rigging by Syngman Rhee.
					
					 A press release was read out.
					
					 It said that there is no democracy in south Korea where one can hardly breathe.
					
					 It called for sternly punishing those involved in the election rigging and fabrication of the spy case and launching a special inspection for probing the truth.
					
					 It noted that members of the council would stage a hunger strike at Chonggye Square till April 19 in the do-or-die spirit and conduct a signature campaign, information activities, press conference, candlelight rally, etc.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's European Junket Termed Anti-Reunification, Confrontational
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's European Junket Termed Anti-Reunification, Confrontational 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- During her recent trip to the Netherlands and Germany South Korean chief executive Park Geun Hye was very busy taking part in the third "nuclear security summit" and holding summits with the U.S. and Japan. She also toured different places, asserting in her speeches the need to learn from the "experience of unification".
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary terms her European junket a criminal anti-reunification and confrontational one to escalate anti-DPRK nuclear racket with the help of outsiders, push the north-south relations into a catastrophe again and realize her deep-seated ambition for invasion of the DPRK.
					
					 The news analyst goes on:
					
					 She promised to work to build confidence and stop slandering but behind the scene she hatched plots with outsiders to malignantly slander fellow countrymen and do harm to them. Her double-dealing attitude is disgusting, indeed.
					
					 The most reasonable way of reunifying the country and achieving prosperity common to the nation as required by the nation is the reunification by a federal formula.
					
					 Park has gone desperate to "gain a big opportunity of unification" while failing to see even an inch ahead. But she should clearly know that it will be too late to regret deeply when a reunified Korea imposingly emerges. 
					
					 She made a big blunder during her trip. This resulted in further deepening the mistrust and escalating confrontation between the north and the south.
					
					 The south Korean chief executive should think twice that her single word and behavior may cast a big shadow on the north-south relations and the destiny of south Koreans, the commentary warns.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed by International Community
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed by International Community 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Voices of People Tuesday in an editorial slammed the present south Korean authorities' crackdown upon the trade unions censured by the international community.
					 The editorial went on:
					
					 In March, the Governing Body of the International Labour Organization (ILO) expressed deep concern over the south Korean "government's" crackdown upon labor organizations including the Teachers Union and adopted a report urging it to take measures. 
					
					 The ILO has so far censured the article of the law on disqualifying dismissed workers as unionists as violation of the principle of freedom of association and demanded the authorities revise or repeal it.
					
					 However, the Park Geun Hye's regime forced the Teachers Union to modify its statute in a way to disqualify dismissed members as unionists but deprived the trade unions of their legal status last year, when the demand was not complied. It became a target of international criticism for ignoring the recommendation of the world labor circle related to the demand.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime has been under fire for ceaseless cases that brought shame to the people. They included teasing of a woman by the spokesman for Chongwadae that drew worldwide censure at the outset of her office, the case of attempted rebellion which is jeered as a witch hunt in the 21st century, the application for a trial demanding the dissolution of the Unified Progressive Party and a forgery of foreign official documents for the fabrication of a spy case. 
					
					 Not content with this, the regime is suppressing the Teachers' Union, becoming a laughing stock of the international community.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Anti-reunification Remarks Blasted by Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Anti-reunification Remarks Blasted by Koreans in U.S.
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. released a commentary blasting the anti-reunification remarks of Park Geun Hye on March 31.
					 The commentary branded the "three-point proposal for laying foundations for peace and unification" made by Park during her trip to Germany as an unrealistic lie.
					
					 The proposal is full of calls for denouncing the north, isolating it internationally and bringing it down in the end, the commentary said, and went on:
					
					 What she proposed first is the "solution of humanitarian issue" such as the regular reunion of separated families and relatives.
					
					 To call for so-called regular meeting without improving the relations with the north, the dialogue partner, is prompted by a political purpose.
					
					 Second, Park proposed what she called "prosperity common to the south and the north" and "laying foundations for improving people's livelihood."
					
					 It is nothing but a word play for Park to make such a proposal as she is well aware that the north-south exchanges would be impossible without the lifting of the "May 24 step."
					
					 The south side scattered anti-DPRK leaflets and instigated "defectors from the north" to slander the north.
					
					 Park even found fault with the north's line on simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 During her European trip she made no scruple of slandering the north, revealing before the international community her stand of insulting the north where her fellow countrymen live.
					
					 Third, Park proposed "recovering homogeneity between inhabitants in the south and the north". She also called for creating opportunities for them to meet often.
					
					 How can NGO contacts be expanded without premise on improving the north-south relations?
					
					 It is an abnormal way of thinking to demand the north denuclearize itself first, while becoming vocal that the north's nukes only are problematic and the nukes in the U.S. and south Korea do not pose any problem.
					
					 If they hope for a world without nuclear weapons, they should dismantle their nukes first.
					
					  Park should look after the south Korean inhabitants first before talking about others.
					
					 Suspicious is her mentality as she calls for dialogue with the north while harshly criticizing it. 
					
					 It is not a proper stand on dialogue to propose anything which the north can hardly accept.
					
					 In a word, her proposal is an insult to the north and is of no help to mending the north-south ties.
					
					 It is likely to further deteriorate the north-south ties.
					
					 If the north-south ties plunge into a total deadlock due to her proposal, Park will be held wholly responsible for making a speech full of lies in Dresden in order to slander the north and continue pursuing the policy of antagonizing fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Il Sung's Exploits Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Il Sung's Exploits Held in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung were held in Mexico, DR Congo and Indonesia on March 22 and 26. They were sponsored by the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo and the Diversity Party of Indonesia.
					 Displayed in the venues of the seminars were photos dealing with the sacred revolutionary careers and immortal exploits of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also on display were famous works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea who doubles as president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, praised Kim Il Sung as a distinguished thinker and theoretician who always led the Korean revolution and global socialist cause to victory, the eternal leader of the Korean people and peerlessly elder statesman.
					
					 He stressed that the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence would shine forever along with the prosperity of Juche Korea.
					
					 The chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo highly praised Kim Il Sung as a great man of the century who achieved the historical cause of Korea's liberation from the military occupation of the Japanese imperialists, frustrated the aggression and challenges of the U.S. imperialists and built socialist Korea centered on the popular masses under the unfurled banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 He said that the non-aligned movement opposing domination and subordination of the imperialists and aspiring after the independent development could make tangible contributions to the development of the human history under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Nurdin Purnomo, chairman of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia, stressed that the banner of independence which Kim Il Sung held high still serves as the driving force greatly encouraging progressive mankind.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences, Kim Jong Un's Work Studied in Romania, Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences, Kim Jong Un's Work Studied in Romania, Mexico
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A reading session, a seminar and a briefing on the reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung and a work of supreme leader Kim Jong Un were held in Romania and Mexico on Mar. 25 and 27 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of the President.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, read out the first volume of Part 1 The Anti-Japanese Revolution of "With the Century", reminiscences of the President, and said:
					
					 The President, born into a patriotic and revolutionary family, was the great leader who embarked on the road of revolution in his teens, founded the immortal Juche idea and successfully led the struggle for the prosperity of the country and people's happiness.
					
					 The reminiscences "With the Century" written by the President offers us an opportunity to know well how great he was.
					
					 He was a prominent leader deeply revered by not only the Korean people but the world people.
					
					 Therefore, preparatory committees for celebrating his birth anniversary are being formed in many countries to mark it as a common holiday of humankind.
					
					 We warmly congratulate the Korean people on greeting the Day of the Sun (his birth anniversary).
					
					 Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, explained in detail the contents of Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Paper 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The 10th issue of the Russian paper Veteran carried an article titled "People always remember and revere" on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 The paper said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, defended socialism and honorably displayed the dignity of the DPRK before the world in the most difficult period.
					
					 The state and social system were further consolidated and solid foundations for the victorious advance of the socialist cause and the defence of the sovereignty laid in the DPRK thanks to his Songun politics. 
					
					 He strengthened the People's Army into invincible revolutionary armed forces fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique.
					
					 He rallied the popular masses around the Workers' Party of Korea and cemented the harmonious whole of the army and people.
					
					 The DPRK adorned a brilliant chapter of the history of the global socialist movement under his energetic leadership.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Serbian Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Serbian Party Leader 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Cerbia Batric Mijovic made public a statement on March 25 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 Comrade Kim Il Sung embarked on the road of revolution in his early years. He defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation and firmly defended the dignity and sovereignty of the country and nation and built the DPRK into a socialist paradise centered on the popular masses. 
					
					 He put forward the once exploited and oppressed people as the master of history and put the dignity of the Korean nation on the highest level. 
					
					 He was the most prominent leader and world's elder statesman who performed extraordinary exploits on behalf of the country, people, era and history with his profound idea and theories, outstanding leadership ability and great revolutionary practice. 
					
					 The Korean people are solving all issues arising in the nation-building and activities as required by his idea and intention and working epochal miracles and changes in the drive to build a thriving nation, holding him in high esteem as eternal President of the DPRK and the sun. 
					
					 The exploits he performed for the global cause of independence will shine long with the century. 
					
					 He will always live in the hearts of progressive people.

articles.title: Demo against U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Held in Britain
articles.content:
Demo against U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Held in Britain
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A demonstration protesting against the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and the U.S. joint military drills for aggression and anti-DPRK "human rights" racket took place outside the U.S. embassy in London on March 27. 
					 Attending the demonstration were personages of the New Communist Party of Britain, British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association and other masses. 
					
					 Demonstrators were holding placards reading "Gis, get out of south Korea", "Down with imperialism" and "U.S. imperialists threaten peace on the Korean peninsula by kicking off the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills". 
					
					 Speakers said that the U.S. is describing the joint military drills as "annual ones" but they are war drills to stifle Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses based on the Juche idea in light of the equipment and personnel involved in the drills. 
					
					 They branded the "human rights" racket kicked off by the U.S. and its followers as moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Waving flags of the DPRK and chanting anti-U.S. slogans, demonstrators strongly demanded the U.S. stop at once the war drills for aggression, withdraw its troops from south Korea, lift its hostile policy toward the DPRK and all sanctions and drop the "human rights" racket against it. 
					
					 They distributed leaflets exposing the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK to passers-by.

articles.title: Thai Organizations Support DPRK's Stand
articles.content:
Thai Organizations Support DPRK's Stand 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand and the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association expressed support for the statement of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
					 The organizations said in their joint statement on March 25:
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and the moves pursuant to it are now going over to a very serious stage. 
					
					 The U.S. "sanctions" against the DPRK, moves to "isolate and blockade" it and open military threats to it over its self-defensive nuclear deterrence are driving the situation on the Korean peninsula into an unpredictable brink of a war. Its "human rights" racket against the DPRK for no reason is going beyond the tolerance limit. 
					
					 The U.S. made no scruple of slandering even the results of the recent election of deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly in the DPRK though it was held with success.
					
					 The U.S. should totally roll back its anachronistic hostile policy to the DPRK with the right viewpoint and stand on its nuclear deterrence and stop at once the groundless "human rights" racket against it. 
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people would frustrate the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, confidently advance along the road of independence chosen by themselves and thus achieve the final victory. 
					
					 We fully support the statement of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente del Congo Democratico
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente del Congo Democratico
Pyongyang, 3 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 2 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente del Congo Democratico, Joseph Kabila Kabange, en relacion con que recientemente hubo muchas perdidas humanas en ese pais por el hundimiento de barco.
					El remitente expresa en su misiva profunda compasion y condolencias al destinatario, las victimas del accidente y sus familiares.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Senegal
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Senegal
Pyongyang, 3 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion a Macky Sall, presidente de la Republica del Senegal, con motivo del 54o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					En la misiva el remitente expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Senegal se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran de continuo conforme al interes y deseo comunes de los pueblos de los dos paises y desea al destinatario y a su pueblo mayores exitos en sus labores para asegurar la paz y la estabilidad del pais y lograr el desarrollo economico.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente eslovaco
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente eslovaco
Pyongyang, 3 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam envio el 31 de marzo un mensaje de felicitacion a Andrej Kiska, electo presidente de la Republica de Eslovaquia.
					En la misiva el remitente expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones entre Corea y Eslovaquia se ampliaran y se desarrollaran conforme al interes y el deseo comunes de los pueblos de ambos paises y desea al destinatario exitos en sus labores para el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais y para el fomento del bienestar del pueblo eslovaco.

articles.title: Comandantes del EPC realizan recorrido por lugares de batalla revolucionaria
articles.content:
Comandantes del EPC realizan recorrido por lugares de batalla revolucionaria
Pyongyang, 3 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar del 23 de marzo al primero de abril el recorrido de los comandantes de las unidades combinadas del Ejercito Popular de Corea por los lugares de batalla revolucionaria de la zona del monte Paektu.
					Los comandantes sostuvieron el 23 de marzo en la explanada frente al Monumento a la Victoria en la Batalla de Pochonbo el acto de partida del grupo de recorrido.
					
					Los miembros del grupo rindieron tributo tras depositar cestos y ramos de flores ante la estatua de bronce del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung erguida en el monumento.
					
					En el acto los oradores juraron aprender profundamente a traves del recorrido el origen y la historia de victoria orgullosa de la revolucion del Songun y prepararse como defensores fidedignos y ejecutores materiales de la tradicion revolucionaria.
					
					Acto seguido, quedo iniciado el recorrido.
					
					En la tierra historica donde se habia librado la batalla de Pochonbo organizada y dirigida por el Generalisimo, los miembros del grupo estuvieron en varios puntos. 
					
					El 24 de marzo, visitaron la casa natal del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en el campamento secreto del monte Paektu.
					
					Ellos dieron vueltas por el campamento del pico Saja, el lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Rimyongsu, el campamento de Chongbong, el de Konchang y el del pico Pegae y llegaron el 27 de marzo al lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Samjiyon al cabo de la marcha por la "carretera Kapsan-Musan para la guarnicion fronteriza".
					
					Los comandantes rindieron tributo al Presidente Kim Il Sung tras depositar ante su estatua los cestos y ramos de flores.
					
					Tras pasar por el campamento de Mupho, el lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Sinsadong, llegaron al Monumento a la Victoria en la Batalla de la Zona de Musan y realizaron en el lugar de batalla de Taehongdan la competencia de tiro.
					
					Frente a la lapida con el poema dedicado a la bifurcacion del monte Paektu, realizaron el acto de juramento y partieron hacia al Conjunto Monumental de Samjiyon.
					
					En el acto de juramento de los comandantes que tuvo lugar solemnemente en la explanada de educacion de dicho conjunto monumental con la participacion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, los participantes juraron armarse firmemente con el espiritu revolucionario del Paektu y apoyar fielmente la direccion del Comandante Supremo sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun.
					
					Realizaron el acto de presentacion de reminiscencias de los guerrilleros  antijaponeses, la reunion en torno a la fogata, el estudio con preguntas y respuestas y otras labores.
